text: Americans love themselves from July 4th
those fireworks the barbecues but is
this more of an excuse to party than a
celebration of patriotism what do
Americans really think of their country
well according to the Pew Research
Center over half of the u.s. says they
are often proud to be in America
still if we break it down by age there's
a difference in which generations really
see themselves as patriotic so that's
patriotism but how do Americans think
the u.s. is doing overall less than half
think America's best years are still yet
to come but again there's a generational
difference more Millennials are
optimistic about the future then baby
boomers are optimistic no doubt there's
some nostalgia going on here for earlier
days in just three years the number of
people who think the u.s. stands above
all other countries has fallen by 10
percent perhaps some of this has to do
with the rise of China if we look at pew
research data from January here's the
growing percentage of Americans who
think China is the world's leading
economic power that doesn't mean America
doesn't deserve to celebrate beating the
British yes people may think the
international stage is shifting but most
still believe America is one of the
greatest countries just not the only
greatest country
David Botti BBC News Washington
